superseding_details.component_description: Replacement frontages to No. 10 High Street

building_details.building_ref: N/A - No new building or increase

description: Change of use from nightclub (Use Class Sui Generis) to a mixed use venue including event/music space, cinema, drinking establishment/bar, food kiosk and cafe (Mixed Use, Classes Sui Generis and E) and associated internal and external alteration involving the creation of part mezzanine level and new shopfront/entrances.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) - A100 OS Map, A101 Block Plan, A102 Existing Context Photos, A103 Existing Ground Floor Plan, A104 Proposed Ground Floor Plan, A105 Existing Basement Level, A106 Proposed Basement Level, A107 Proposed Mezzanine Level, A501 Existing Context Elevations with Both Entrances to Basement, A502 Existing and Proposed Elevations and Sections Entrance 1 to Cinema, A503 Existing and Proposed Elevations and Sections Entrance 2 to Cinema, Acoustic Statement prepared by Auricl Acoustic Consulting dated 21 December 2020, Cover Letter prepared JLL dated 23 December 2020, Design & Access Statement prepared by Wren Architecture & Design dated 21 December 2020, Mechanical Ventilation Statement prepared by Wren Architecture & Design dated 21 December 2020.
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match those indicated in the approved plans.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The hours of operation shall be restricted to 08:00 until 00:00hrs Sundays to Thursdays and Public Holidays, and 08:00 until 02:30hrs Fridays and Saturdays. Deliveries of goods to, and waste collections from the proposed development shall only take place during the period 0800 - 1800 hrs on Mondays to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public Holidays.

REASON: In the interests of safeguarding the residential amenity of nearby residents in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 Noise and Vibration, London Plan Policy D14 (2021) and National Planning Policy Framework (2019) - Section 12 Achieving well-designed places. | The development shall implement sound insulation of the floor/ceiling/walls separating the premises from dwellings/noise sensitive premises which achieves a maximum NR25 Lmax(fast) from structure borne/ impact noise and NR20 Leq,5min from general airborne noise (including music) in bedrooms, when noise is generated at maximum capacity within the premises, based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. The sound insulation shall be implemented prior to occupation and thereafter be permanently retained.

REASON: In the interests of the living conditions of future residential occupiers, in accordance with Interim Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D14 and SI1 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The development's proprietary materials and installations for sound absorption, anti-vibration mounts, floor treatment, sound limiters and/or other mitigation measures for the isolation of equipment/walls/floors and loudspeakers, orientation of sound sources away from structures connected to dwellings/noise sensitive premises within the same and/or adjoining buildings, minimization of sound transmission shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and demonstrate that noise limits of BS8233:2014 within noise sensitive premises will not be exceeded, shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration/noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.

| The use shall not commence until all external doors have been fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time shall any external door nor windows to rooms where noise, smell, smoke or fumes may be emitted, be fixed in an open position during the emission of noise.

REASON: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
